page.title: 16FRAMPTON VILLAGE ACTIVITIES
page.content: The{Candlemas Supper}is a delicious 5 course meal enjoyed by 80 members of the two Frampton churches. One person is chiefly responsible for the cooking. The young people serve the meal.The identity of the cast in the pantomime which follows is always a closely kept secret. The production in 1985 was "Who's Been Stalking" which included the appearance of a 3m giant! {Frampton Gardens Open Weekend}was at the end of June when 11 gardens were open to the public on Saturday and Sunday afternoons. Teas were served in the garden of Cotton Hall. Programmes at Â£1 with a printed route gave admittance to all 11 gardens. The event raised Â£800+ for church funds. Other events include Whist Drives, Beetle Drives, Jumble Sales, Sausage & Mash Supper and a Wine Tasting.
